reviews.text:
3.9.2019 This is the beat $5 you can spend if you like Asian art / statues.  There were so much beautiful items to look at and read about. From hand carved tusks to Jade flower trees and hand stitched clothing in between, you get to see a little bit of everything from ancient Asia.

PS There are public bathrooms in the center of the museum, this was helpful for me.

I was amazed and impressed at the collection this museum had. If you live in or near Memphis or are just visiting for the weekend, make time to stop by. You will not be disappointed. The staff was friendly and helpful. Also, make sure to bring a few nickels so you can watch and listen to a self-playing piano and violin concert machine. That was really awesome!

It had the most jade, and ivory collection I've ever seen. Beautiful and intricate pieces. However everything looked like it was from China. Not representative of other Asian cultures. There was nothing represented by Japan, Thailand, Korea, Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia. Let's call it the chinese and judaic  museum, and not Asian! Also, the pieces didn't have any estimated dates on them. Not even which dynasty it came from. Was the jade made last year or 300 years ago? That would be helpful.

This is a museum worth checking out. A hidden jewel in Memphis that I didn’t realize was here. Downtown on Mainstreet and has everything Asian. Beautiful art, carvings and jade figures, very detailed.  There is so much history here. There is a souvenir shop. This weekend we went there was arts and crafts. Face painting, coloring and panda art paining. This was an assignment from Collierville Middle school and we were glad, this was a very educational experience.

I want to see some dates of when the art was created. Am I looking at some Jade that is 1 year old 100 years old, of what. Not knowing much about Jade this was otherwise a wonderful place. Jam packed with art.  Also included was an amazing display of photos and history of Memphis residents who are WW II Holocaust survivors.
It was wonderful. The staff was great. All the kids enjoyed there self even the teens. We were there for my 4 year old nephew Birthday Party.
Recommend to come with children. Interactive,  and informative. Lots of fun for little's ones!

Looked on line to get information, directions,  hours, and cost. It said it was free. Yet when I found a parking spot and paid for parking, and entered, the lady in museum said it would be $28. I told her I saw on the internet that it was a free event. She said no it's out there but that's not true. My kids and I were disappointed. When you're traveling and organizing events. You pay for some and some it's nice to have free. Yet when I explain that , she didn't seem to care.

I have had the honor of visiting the Memphis Fire Museum on several occasions since it was opened including its grand opening!

The Memphis Fire Museum is a must stop when visiting downtown. The building is beautiful and the museum is great for both children and adults. The honor and history held in the walls of the museum are a must see for any public safety personnel.

Centrally located in downtown Memphis the Fire Museum is just a short walk away from several other attractions and restaurants.
A must see the paintings were awesome.

See this one before you visit Stax or Sun.  It's a quick overview of Blues to early Rock to Soul. Well curated with a timeline that runs from the roots of blues music, through the country music Branch to 50's and some 60's rock and roll before touching on soul. It is a history museum that centers around Memphis and Memphis music, not a hall of fame for classic rock.

Headsets are provided with the entry ticket. There is a "master play list" that can be accessed with complete original versions of songs. It's interesting how many famous artists covered so many of these songs. There is a small area at then end which focus on Elvis's movie posters and fortunately it's small.
Must see attraction for any music lover! Many interesting historic items to see and listen to. It's audio guided so that's a plus for the visually impaired. Simply amazing.

Very well thought out and organized museum which delved not only in rock and soul but how the people and music shaped the civil rights movement in the south. I liked the way you could stop at the jukeboxes displayed throughout the exhibit and listen to your choice of music. The provide headphones and it's go at your own pace so you could easily while away a 2 hours here. Some areas may be a little tight but it's wheelchair accessible and offer a AAA discount!

Great museum. We stopped here after having a nice meal on Beale street. There were not many people which was nice so we were able to enjoy most of the exhibits. Being a wrestling fan I loved the Sputnik Monroe area. We will definitely be returning on our next vacation

Beautiful museum full of story, The museum’s digital audio tour guide is packed with over 300 minutes of information, including over 100 songs. It takes visitors at their own pace through seven galleries featuring 3 audio visual programs, more than 30 instruments, 40 costumes, and other musical treasures.
At the gift shop you can get some souvenirs as well.

A lot of historical information here, presented in a way that I believe makes learning fun for all. Went in with my daughter today and we had a great time. She needed to do a review on one gallery and one museum and we both enjoyed the trip.  Will definitely be back for another visit soon.

I am here from Dallas to see a nephew's wedding. 
This is an extremely well kept historical building, with a great and helpful staff.
I would be crazy not to mention a great place for outdoor and indoor weddings.
Keep up the great work Pink Palace.
Ask for Christine & Conner with Drapers Catering

This is a wonderful example of a museum that blends local history with cultural, natural, and science history as well. The recent renovations were made with care and consideration which is palpable as you walk through the halls of the mansion. The charm of this place has not changed since I was a kid and now I'm sharing that magic with my child and will for years to come. Do yourself and your family a favor and step back in time to the historic Pink Palace Mansion and Museum. I promise you'll learn something new and get a sense of why Memphis is such a unique place!
Excellent place with free summer admission for families.  Lots of antiques and historical art and information.  I love the member only events.

Not worth going to anymore. They've gone up in prices, and they now rent the mansion out. Save you money. Full price for only 2 exhabits. Go to the zoo or the mall. They are more interesting. I grew up going here and they NEVER rented the mansion out before.

we stopped in for the afternoon and took a walk around the property. the trails around the nature center offer beautiful scenery even in the middle of winter. a good place to see some native wildlife close to memphis! the indoor displays are very informative and educational. great place for all ages!
Great place to spend the day. Beautiful walking paths and a really neat nature center displaying local wildlife. This is also a great event space to host a get together or party. We love this space.
We had or work Christmas breakfast here. Good sized rooms. Great place also to learn some things about nature and animals.
My son had his wedding there.
Wonderful place to spend the afternoon. Good exhibits and nice trails.

The Stax Museum is a must see for those who enjoy music history. The museum an expansive well curated museum with a balance of exhibits, artifacts and historical interpretation.  As far as music museums go Stax is one of the best and well worth the amazingly low ticket price and two hours or more you will spend here. Staff is knowledgeable and friendly. Gift shop is equally well done.
Loved taking my students here in 2014 and again today! Knowledgeable staff, cool museum, and a unique gift shop. Perfect place to visit if you love soul music!
Stay Museum is a cool place. You can feel the history just standing on the corner of the building! I really enjoyed seeing Isaac Hayes car and enjoyed the Vinyl Records hallway!
The museum is outstanding for someone who likes R&B or Soul music. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I especially liked the fact the museum supports a school for music.

First of all - a little history: The museum is a reproduction of the old Stax recording studio which was destroyed in 1989. The rejuvenation was due to the efforts of local residents and generous individuals who began a nonprofit rebirth of the area. The museum opened in 2003 and is a showcase emcompassing over 15,000sf. During a visit you can see a part of historical Memphis. There are photographs, instruments which were used to record actual hit songs, costumes, videos and interactive exhibits. Do you remember the show "Soul Train" ? The actual dance floor is there. One of the most amazing exhibits is an actual church which is over 100 years old. Other exhibits change throughout the year. Some of my personal favorite artists associated with Stax were Otis Redding, Sam & Dave and Isaac Hayes. Some of the best videos include Aretha, Marvin Gaye, The Jackson Five, Sam Cooke and the list goes on and on. This is truly a wonderful place to spend plenty of time.

Came here with some people on a business trip. Great bartenders, down to earth atmosphere, and friendly locals. They have a pool table and a great jukebox, and serve great burgers as well as a good beer selection.
The history here makes it definitely one of the top places to check out in Memphis! Live soul music and great burgers. Highly recommend!

Neat little hole in the wall with a lot of attitude. We heard about this place from one of the locals and we enjoyed our visit. They also had a blues band that night, which added a funky music background.
Friendly bar staff, amazing burgers, a ton of history and a perfect "dive bar" atmosphere. Go on a weekday night when it is quiet for an upstairs self guided tour. I loved it.
Awesome place. So much better then anything on Beal st. Highly recommend. I would say 5++ stars ⭐️

Look the place isn't bad. Service was good and we got in fairly quick. But it just seemed like you were paying for the experience of eating at a location instead of what it's worth. The steak strips were great but was it worth the money? Meh. Kind of but not really. If you're going to say "hey I went to Huey's in Memphis" then it's worth it. But if you need a place for good pricing that matches the food ,try somewhere else. That's why I'm rating a 4 out of 5 instead of a 2. They have a name, a history, and great location. But other than that it's pub food at downtown pricing.

Stopped there 2 hours before the Memphis Redbird vs St Louis game. Crowded but got a booth for 4 in 10 seconds. Food was Great. Service was Great. Price was very good. There was a line of 30 people to get in when we left. We will be back.

Great place to visit late night. Food is always good. On band night it does get loud. Hard to hear yourself think or order.
People are usually on best behavior, never seen any off color problems.
Staff friendly.

Great service and yummy food!  Our server Nicky was personable and made sure everything was exactly as we ordered.  The owner was on the floor beside the wait staff helping them which spoke volumes to us.  Definitely recommend it you are in the area for good food, great atmosphere and a hella awesome server named Nicky.
High energy pub and grub. Great local history  All the TVs were on March Madness.  Food is excellent and lots of it.

Amazing place. great service. family friendly environment. the barbecue place has the best barbecue I've had and that's saying something since I've had a lot of barbecue. if I'm ever in the area again I'm definitely stopping by. their cornbread is also amazing and their banana pudding tastes homemade in a great way.

I know Memphis is popular for barbecue but you haven't had Memphis style until you try it here. There's a reason central is always loaded with people. They know where to get the best.  Meat smoked perfectly and moist.  Their sauces are outstanding and never a long wait for your meal. Ribs are out of this world.

Central BBQ definitely has some of the best Mac & Cheese I have had in a long time. Not sure what they put on top of it, but it is definitely a side I would eat again. I tried the Pulled Pork Sandwich and it was pretty good. I feel it could have used more BBQ sauce, but I’m not sure if that’s something your supposed to add yourself or if that’s what they have came to think is a good amount. Atmosphere is very enjoyable. Lots of people so you might have to wait a few minutes to order but they have your food out to you pretty quick!

The smoked pork ribs where absolutely delectable and fall-off-the-bone tender, and the sauce boosted the flavor to maximum. I loved the vinegar sauce option as well for a few tangy bites and as a dipping sauce for the pork rinds! What really set Central BBQ - Midtown apart though was the amazing service and staff. They got my food to me with smiles on their faces quickly and effectively, and I cannot thank them enough. I recommend the jerked chicken wings too, they know how to do wings!

I can never have BBQ again back home after dining here. We ordered the slab for two (half wet, half dry) and it was phenomenal. It was just the right amount of food for two people that will leave you full. 

The order is placed at the counter and then you go find a place to sit. Service is fast and we only had to wait a few minutes for our food. 

The restaurant can get a bit crowded inside and parking took some time.

It's really too badd that it's only possible to give 5 stars for this restaurant. I was with a large group here tonight and I can tell you without a doubt the wait staff did a top notch job the entire evening. Both the service and the food were amazing. I had the cowboy rib eye And it was 22 oz of steak heaven. If you're looking for something a cut above,  look no further.

This is one of the best restaurants ever! The food was amazing and the waiter was so kind. He answered all of our questions, which was a lot. It has such a fascinating history about the restaurant. This is definitely a place that my family and I will come back to!!

Delicious! I ordered the prime rib steak and it was delicious. Tender, flavorful, hot & sizzling meal with a delicious red to pair. That was a treat for my wedding day. Wonderful must try. It's a true steak kouse so the price is not your typical every other day food affair. Enjoy. Limited parking immediately close by but across the street is a movie theater with ample parking.

The food was amazing and I cant get over the fact of how lovely the ambiance of the place was. They have valet parking (which is a plus!) Be prepared to spend some money!! Everything on the menu is a la carte and its very expensive.... However, we celebrated a birthday here and it was top notch service till the end and everything we ordered was AMAZING so the prices were worth it. Put on your best clothes and grab a reservation, because it gets crowded fast. I highly recommend this place, I will be returning.

The best place to have a Very special Romantic, Anniversary, or Birthday dinner. There are private rooms to eat in for you and your date. The Staff are soooo very helpful and always on point to serve you.
Just be sure to be financially ready for a great night. But very well worth the money for a night with someone you love. Folks Folly is a true Memphis gem of the city. Enjoy :)

Great pizza!  Homemade sauce, awesome crust.  The room is large and the atmosphere is very cool.  Great music by local artist on special night's.  Tuesday's they have open Mic night.   Good folks,  great food,  great service.

Came in tonight to meet a friend. I'm truly upset that I didn't know about this place. Great atmosphere, great pizza with an awesome crust. It's a laid back bar masquerading as a awesome pizzeria. What's better, the bar or the food? Both are great, but the people and the atmosphere make it. Do yourself a favor and go grab a beer and a slice, you never know.

I can't believe I'm the first person writing a review for this place on Google. Over the past few years I go there every few months as a sort of treat for a very nice meaty sandwich. I like the #33 with onions and mushrooms. Tastes almost better when you save half of it and put it in the microwave the next day. like a super awesome hot pocket. 
I have 1 complaint, Jim's does not offer seasoned potato wedges & nacho cheese which, coupled with above described sandwich and an Orange Crush ( which Jim's does have in the cooler ) would combine to make up perhaps one of the most divinely pleasing meals in Memphis.

To the only negative review on this listing,  I say go to hell.  Yes, Jim's son is "Different ".  Does that make his food any less appetizing?   Jim puts out Outstanding food at a reasonable price.  5 stars.
Really good pizza. Nothing against the place, just FYI  if you don't know: I was surprised that the atmosphere was more like a bar than a pizza shop.

Oh my, Oh my!!! Such a wonderful selection of pies, cookies, and my personal favorite  CUPCAKES!!  Everything I have ever eaten from here was the best. And i am a baker so i can judge!! Moist, delicious,  not sickly sweet. Loved the German chocolate cupcakes!  The staff are always super friendly and the atmosphere is too! Bring your kids.
Every time we come it’s like a sweet oasis in the middle of Memphis. Really loved the mimosa cupcake- the champagne flavor was awesome! Totally blows every other place in town away.

Solid selection. Open fairly late for a bake shop. Affordable prices. Vegan options (if you’re into that)
Will definitely be back

The cupcakes are perfectly sized and have an excellent ratio of cake to frosting.  The cake is delicate and fluffy.  The frosting is sugary and has the slightest crust where it is exposed to the air.  The staff is friendly and helpful (and adorably sing to the soundtrack playing). There is usually a line but it moves quickly.

Best cupcakes ever! The cup cake icing is so good , people buys containers of icing alone. The service is u always warm and friendly even when it is crowed. They also sell whole pies, whole cakes, and slices.

One of the better options for Japanese food in Chattanooga. The building is nice and never feels crowded, probably because it has such nice high ceilings. Classic old brick exterior wall, nicely finished. Extensive menu, including early bird options and a sushi buffet on Friday’s at lunch time. Great value and very pleasant service.

Had vegan options and I have to say - Best vegan sushi I’ve ever had! Creative and delicious, I was pleasantly surprised. I had the Buttercup Roll. Staff was very friendly and food came quickly. Will definitely be back next time we’re in Chattanooga :)

There isn't many things I can eat anymore. 
I ordered the vegetable rolls.  Loved them! The lady that took my order, I believe was one of the owners, was so kind.  I would definately recommend this place.

Not sure what happened. I've heard only good things about Sekisui. My first experience here, ordered two chicken teriyaki delivered for dinner. Both were overcooked and tasted overly charred. Portions were surprisingly small for the price. Not impressed. Would not recommend.

Last night, my girlfriend and I wanted some good sushi in Chattanooga and we looked online. I never do ratings but I feel like I should this time. We saw that the health rating was 79 but we figured it wasn’t the food it was maybe the cleanliness either way we should’ve listened. I ordered 2 rolls the crunchy crab and spicy tuna which has the raw tuna in it. I’m not sure what it was, maybe the crab meat or the raw tuna. All I do know is I woke up today with a really bad stomach burning sensation(not a good one) and diarrhea.
Beautiful restaurant! Beautiful food quality! I LOVED eating here! The food was so good, and the waitress was beyond nice and attended to our every need. Highly recommended.

Went here for Valentine's Day, and had a great experience. Our server, Christopher Blair, was very friendly. He was prepared with a wine list and helpful with suggestions for appetizers and entrée selections. The atmosphere and food are great for an Italian restaurant. The rubber duck in their fountain is a cute silly touch. My sweetheart seemed to enjoy our date here.

I'd definitely recommend eating here. They're no more expensive than the cookie cutter Italian chains and it's actually authentic. Service is always excellent. Their Italian spinach is the best I've ever had.
The service was good. The atmosphere is very cute and Italian. The food was not so great. Alfredo sauce was pretry bland. Shrimp was well cooked though. And table roll was pretty crispy and chewy.
Good food. Four adults meals, 1 appetizer and 2 desserts for $125. Interesting interior, relaxed atmosphere. Good service.

I have been going to this place for years. The food is always delicious. The owner is very friendly, and the food is prepared at the time you order it, so it is hot and fresh. I love the large bowl of Tom Yum soup.

Uses low quality ingredients. Veggies were not fresh, oil used for frying was probably very old. Got really bad throat infection after eating at this place. 
Service was really bad. Took 40 min to get the appetizers.
Needs remodel. Needs server who can understand English.
The Tom Yum at Tycoon is by far the best in Memphis - just don't wear a white shirt when you eat it!
Some of the best on the east side of memphis!!!! Always hot fresh and tasty! Staff has always been friendly! Been eating here since 2005!
Best Asian food in town, imo. Singapore noodles can't be beat!

Our number one choice for Mexican food is Taqueria Mi Puebla! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu (steak and shrimp street tacos pictured) because it is all so good! The service is great even when they are packed and you can't go wrong with the atmosphere! You wont be disappointed if you decide to try them for yourself!

I have been here at least 20 times would give Taqueria Mi Pueblo five stars easily. But they almost always fall short with the hostess and waitresses. Especially the head hostess. The lady who takes you to a table has a bad attitude. AlWAYS .One of the experiences of going to a good ,well ran restaurant is to have good service .Smiles ,a good attitude, small talk.Best food in the world and snotty bad attitudes just don't mix. 3 and a half Stars. Would come more often if they would only have a better attitude. Never hello ,never how are you, not even a thank you while paying or leaving. I really like the food.so I don't say anything. I don't want to get 86 from the place you know what I mean.
Omg food was great. It's real authentic Mexican food and is great... Great drinks as well. The mango margarita is a must. Great customer service too!!! This is my new restaurant

The margaritas are huge, tasty, and cheap!! The delicous Paloma had me a little tipsy restaurant despite it's somewhat small size and was cheap so I still give it 5 stars. Fajitas were grilled to perfection. Great prices for everything!! Loved the regular salsa but the hot salsa has an intense cilantro flavor so if you're not a fan of cilantro I'd skip the hot salsa. This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant

I have been eating at this restaurant since the owner grilled the food on the sidewalk. I've watched this place grow into what it is over the years and have supported the owner financially as a loyal customer. However, I will never eat here again due to the simple fact that there is "resist" art in the vestibule area of the restaurant. As a proud American and supporter of our president, I do not feel welcome eating at a restaurant that supports the "resist" movement.

Great pizza!  Homemade sauce, awesome crust.  The room is large and the atmosphere is very cool.  Great music by local artist on special night's.  Tuesday's they have open Mic night.   Good folks,  great food,  great service.

Came in tonight to meet a friend. I'm truly upset that I didn't know about this place. Great atmosphere, great pizza with an awesome crust. It's a laid back bar masquerading as a awesome pizzeria. What's better, the bar or the food? Both are great, but the people and the atmosphere make it. Do yourself a favor and go grab a beer and a slice, you never know.

I can't believe I'm the first person writing a review for this place on Google. Over the past few years I go there every few months as a sort of treat for a very nice meaty sandwich. I like the #33 with onions and mushrooms. Tastes almost better when you save half of it and put it in the microwave the next day. like a super awesome hot pocket. 
I have 1 complaint, Jim's does not offer seasoned potato wedges & nacho cheese which, coupled with above described sandwich and an Orange Crush ( which Jim's does have in the cooler ) would combine to make up perhaps one of the most divinely pleasing meals in Memphis.

To the only negative review on this listing,  I say go to hell.  Yes, Jim's son is "Different ".  Does that make his food any less appetizing?   Jim puts out Outstanding food at a reasonable price.  5 stars.
Really good pizza. Nothing against the place, just FYI  if you don't know: I was surprised that the atmosphere was more like a bar than a pizza shop.
